channel.title: HOWTO run a tor-relay in qubes-whonix?
channel.description:
I've searched both Qubes and Whonix documentation, but so far no result.
I run Qubes with the whonix-gw/ws implementation, and I would like to run a tor-relay. So: **How should I set up a tor-node that runs inside whonix? And should it run in gw or ws-vm?**

item.title: HOWTO run a tor-relay in qubes-whonix?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Yes.

Possible in theory. In practice, kinda difficult since it is undocumented, therefore unsupported. ( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Unsupported )

You’d also need the Qubes specific instructions on how to forward a port:

Qubes OS

The Qubes Firewall

Understanding Qubes networking and firewall Understanding firewalling in Qubes Every qube in Qubes is connected to the network via a FirewallVM, which is used to enforce network-level policies. B...

Forward the port from sys-net to sys-firewall to sys-whonix?

I highly recommend figuring this out with a Debian VM before you try this with sys-whonix.

Read full topic

item.title: HOWTO run a tor-relay in qubes-whonix?
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
I don’t think this is documented yet.

You would need to adapt the Virtualbox instructions for Qubes.

  1. edit torrc: https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-doc-relay.html.en
  2. forward ports to whonix-gateway: https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/qubes-firewall/
  3. edit whonix-gateway firewall: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Hosting_a_(private)_(obfuscated)_bridge_or_(exit)_relay

[Should a separate, dedicated VM be used to host a relay?]

Read full topic
